title: Emma Stone says playing Cruella de Vil in Disney prequel is ‘bananas’
text:
We’re counting down the days until Cruella (Picture: AP, Disney)

Emma Stone paid tribute to the ‘GOAT’ Glenn Close as she steps into her shoes as Cruella de Vil in the upcoming Disney film Cruella.

The La La Land actress, who began filming the 101 Dalmations prequel in London back in September, told Entertainment Tonight that she still couldn’t believe she was playing such an iconic role.

‘It’s pretty trippy. It’s wild,’ Emma she said, adding that she often finds herself thinking: ‘“This is bananas”’ on set.

Set in 1970s London, Emma stars in the upcoming production as a redheaded, punk rock Cruella enjoying life before her dog-napping days.

Paying homage to both the classic animation 101 Dalmations from 1961 and Glenn Close’s iconic portrayal of Cruella in the 1996 version, Emma had only good things to say about the OG live-action scary lady.

‘I think she’s obviously the GOAT (Greatest Of All Time),’ Emma gushed, adding: ‘But I also have just loved the cartoon for a really long time.’

Shooting in September near Liberty just off London’s Regent Street (Picture: Splash News)

She continued: ‘This comes before [the original] story. This leads her to where she becomes true greatness.’

Just when we thought we couldn’t be any more excited for this film…

Starring alongside Emma’s fur-obsessed felon is an impressive cast including Paul Walter Hauser and Joel Fry as Cruella’s idiotic henchmen Jasper and Horace, while queen of everything Emma Thompson will be playing the Baroness. Dream casting or what?

The spin-off, which is one in a long line of Disney remakes, will be directed by the man behind Oscar-nominated film I, Tonya, Craig Gillespie.

Fans looking forward to getting a real glimpse of the young Cruella will have to be patient however, as the movie isn’t due for release in cinemas until May 28, 2021.
